snippet: The principal at a Brooklyn Success Academy charter school who created a “Got to Go” list of difficult students was sued by four parents last month.
abstract: Candido Brown, principal of Success Academy charter school branch in Fort Greene, Brooklyn, who came under fire for creating list of undesirable students, is taking leave of absence; four parents of children on list have filed lawsuit against Success Academy and its network, and against Brown and New York City and State Education Departments.
lead_paragraph: The principal at a Brooklyn Success Academy charter school who created a “Got to Go” list of difficult students was sued by four parents last month.

headline.main: Success Academy Principal Who Created ‘Got to Go’ List Takes Leave
headline.print_headline: Charter School Principal, Under Fire, Takes Leave
